item.description:
Well this should be

interesting, never

been on a pub crawl

before, so thought I'd

give it a whirl.

While researching this elusive sport, I discovered one challenge that was attempted about 4 years ago right here in town. Didn't talk about any results, so not sure if they ever really did finish. Boy, I just cannot think of a more suitable place for a pub crawl than right here in Portsmouth. During my many adventures learning the town, I've found a fail safe way not to get lost. The church steeple, what else! Can't miss it day OR night! I think it must of been built just for this sport. Woooo how some things just all seem to come together for a reason.

Actually this pub crawl is a repeat of one that celebrated Portsmouth Beer Week/Portsmouth Craft Beer Week/Portsmouth Beer Weekend (all the same), Smuttynose hosted a Pub Crawl that highlighted the best bars in town. This wasn't for the weak at liver, as it totaled 7 stops in the course of an afternoon. So let's see what these places are all about so we can get ready for the BIG one that's coming this summer. Hey, I'm planning to focus more on learning the pubs and food than a drunken stupor.

We'll meet at 6 pm at Coat of Arms @ 174 Fleet Street and kick things off from there. Here's a list of all the stops along with some tips on what to expect beer and food wise. The letters below correspond to the letters in the map below.

A- Coat of Arms
(Beer Tip: Whatever's on tap, everything's good)
(Food Tip: Some say the best burger in town- Piccadilly Circus Burger)

B- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: They have a great tap list including Breckenridge Brewing Vanilla Porter)
(Food Tip: If you just ate the burger above, have some chips and salsa here, otherwise just have the chips & salsa)

C- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: Redhook ESB is always a winner here)
(Food Tip: Wings )

D- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: Not sure what to expect, Dos Equis or Red Stripe if anything )
(Food Tip: Take your pick, everything here is good Mexican food)

E- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: Usually have a good tap list here)
(Food Tip: Hear tell wraps are good here)

F- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: The largest tap selection in town, try a Switchback here)
(Food Tip: Curry Chips sounds like a good idea if you have made it this far)

G- To be Announced
(Beer Tip: Great selection, Moat Mountain is usually a go-to here)
(Food Tip: Never ate here, your on your own)

There is no cost on joining us but you will need to be a PAID member before you sign up. You will also need to fund your beverages and food along the way. This is just a cool way of getting together on a Saturday evening for something fun and different! Be there or be square.
item.how_to_find_us: Please pay your membership dues! Questions? Call me @ (603) 759-9876

group.name: The Portsmouth "and beyond" Nite Out Meetup Group

item.name: Portsmouth Pub Crawl ~~~~>
